edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.doc
Class DocBackEndLSP

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.BackEndLSPAdapter
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.doc.DocBackEndLSP
All Implemented Interfaces:
BackEndLSP
Direct Known Subclasses:
TextBackEndLSP, XMLBackEndLSP
public abstract class DocBackEndLSP
extends BackEndLSPAdapter

An abstract BackEndLSP designed to use a search engine to index and access a collection of local, unindexed documents.

A DocBackEndLSP: loads its configuration file, doc_config.xml, from the directory SDARTS_HOME/config/backEndLSPName. (See DocConfigBuilder.)

An implementation of DocBackEndLSP should save and load its meta-attributes and content-summary files in the same directory, using DocMetaAttributesbuilder and DocContentSummaryBuilder It should also use some kind of search engine to index and access the collection. The abstract interface for this search engine is specified in DocSearchEngine.

To make your own implementation of this class, override the getSearchEngine() method. In general, the search engine usually is responsible also for load and saving the meta-attributes and content-summary, using the DocMetaAttributesBuilder and DocContentSummaryBuilder mentioned above.

Two reference implementations of this class are:

  • TextBackEndLSP - uses the search engine from edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.doc.lucene to serve a collection of plain text documents
  • XMLBackEndLSP - uses the search engine from edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.doc.lucene to serve a collection of XML documents

getSearchEngine

public abstract DocSearchEngine getSearchEngine(DocConfig config)
                                         throws BackEndException
Returns an initialized and working search engine to fulfill query, meta-attributes, and content-summary requests. Override this method to create your own concrete implementation of this class. This method gets called by the initialize() method, and should not need to be called directly.
Parameters:
config - the DocConfig object used to configure the DocBackEndLSP
Returns:
a search engine
Throws:
BackEndException - if something goes wrong

getContentSummary

public LSPContentSummary getContentSummary()
                                    throws BackEndException
Reads the content summary file from storage, and returns it. Does not cache, as content summaries tend to be huge.
Returns:
the collection's content summary
